message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education. I need to provide responses to all 10 statements (TT4G35A through TT4G35J) using the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', or 'I don't know'.

I'm instructed to respond as a primary or secondary school teacher from Malta. The responses should reflect a reasonable perspective from such a teacher about the use of AI in education.

Let me think about each statement:

[TT4G35A] - AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is a positive application. Many teachers have found AI useful for this. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35B] - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is also a positive application. AI can help personalize content. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35C] - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - Positive application. AI can provide personalized support. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35D] - AI supports students with specific needs - Positive application. AI can help with accessibility and support for multilingual learners and students with special needs. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35E] - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is widely recognized as a positive use case. I would say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F] - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a negative statement about academic integrity. As a teacher, I would be concerned about this. I would say "Agree" (acknowledging this is a real risk)

[TT4G35G] - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is also a concern. AI can make errors. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35H] - AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a concern about bias in AI. I would say "Agree" (as this is a known risk)


Regarding data protection, I'm concerned about privacy and security risks when using AI systems with student information, so I'd say "Agree" for that statement. As for pedagogical approaches, AI recommendations are generally sound even if imperfect, so I'd lean toward "Disagree" on that concern.
